channel.title: Education News
channel.description: A RSS feed containing the latest education related news from NASA.

item.title: Winners of 2020 NASA Langley Student Art Contest Named
item.description: This year’s contest received a record 1,277 entries from students across the United States.

item.title: #BeAnAstronaut: NASA Seeks Applicants to Explore Moon, Mars
item.description: For the first time in more than four years, NASA began accepting applications Monday for future astronauts. Aspiring Moon to Mars explorers have until 11:59 p.m. EDT Tuesday, March 31, to apply.

item.title: NASA Highlights Minority STEM Education Outreach at CIAA Basketball Tournament
item.description: Billed as “Education Day,” the CIAA partners with science, technology, education and math educators to bring interactive STEM outreach to mostly minority students.

item.title: Florida Students to Speak with NASA Astronaut Aboard Space Station
item.description: Florida students will have an opportunity this week to talk with a NASA astronaut aboard the International Space Station.

item.title: NASA Selects Proposals for Student Aeronautics, Space Projects
item.description: NASA has awarded more than $39.8 million through the agency’s National Space Grant College and Fellowship Project to increase student and faculty engagement in STEM at community colleges, technical schools and universities across the nation.

item.title: Artemis Student Challenge: NASA Selects University Teams to Build Technologies for the Moon’s Darkest Areas
item.description: The selected teams will develop ways to collect data in and around permanently shadowed regions, generate wireless power for future infrastructure, enable autonomous mobility even in the most extreme environments, and more.

item.title: NASA to Pay Tribute to Fallen Heroes with Day of Remembrance
item.description: NASA will honor members of the NASA family who lost their lives while furthering the cause of exploration and discovery, including the crews of Apollo 1 and space shuttles Challenger and Columbia, during the agency's annual Day of Remembrance Thursday, Jan. 30.

item.title: International Students to Speak with NASA Astronauts Aboard Space Station
item.description: International students in Panama will have an opportunity this week to talk with NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

item.title: Texas Students to Speak with NASA Astronauts Aboard Space Station
item.description: Students from Texas will have an opportunity this week to talk with three NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

item.title: NASA’s Newest Astronauts Ready for Space Station, Moon, and Mars Missions
item.description: NASA welcomed 11 new astronauts to its ranks Friday, increasing the number of those eligible for spaceflight assignments that will expand humanity’s horizons in space for generations to come.
